info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 10:37AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1035 AM MST, a band of heavy snow was near Grand Junction moving east at 35 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Palisade around 1055 AM MST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 19 and 79. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 46. Colorado 65 between mile markers 9 and 61. Colorado 141 between mile markers 150 and 162. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
